context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and approve or reject orders within the order approval workflow.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: This use case enables managers to approve or reject orders, facilitating the order approval workflow.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Selected orders are approved or rejected.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
The system shall update order status upon approval or rejection.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the criteria for order approval or rejection.
main_flow: 1. Manager initiates the order approval process → System displays pending orders for review.
2. Manager selects an order to review → System presents order details.
3. Manager approves or rejects the order → System updates the order status accordingly.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If no pending orders are available, the system informs the manager that there are no orders to review.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the system encounters an error while updating the order status, it notifies the manager of the failure.
